reviews.review: This game is absolutely fun, sure there will be toxic players and such, but I 100% think that people should play this game.

I didn't have any fun playing this game, only did so because of friends, and even then it was terrible.
If you get an adrenaline rush playing candy crush, then you'll probably like this game.

This game fuels my masochism.

You seethe and cope from a tunneling face camping Legion or Clown, quit for a good minute, then come back for more to satisfy your needs. The instant gratification of hurting yourself more and more is what fuels your addiction. I love Dead by Daylight. DbD is love, DbD is life. 

It's hella fun with friends. Shout-out to the boys that make this game more satisfying to play. Overall, I recommend it. 

11/10 pls tunnel me harder Micheal
You do indeed feel like your dead by daylight when you play
Constantly being updated and having new characters to play as every couple of months

I really think this Game is great, even though it has some minimal flaws. In a Time like this where most Games feel like they were hugely rushed in development this Game just sticks out. 
I really love playing either side and with the right ppl or sometimes just some randoms the Game can and will be really fun. The more effort you put into it the more fun it is mostly.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

i would say this game is fun but it can surely make you angry if you lose your temper quickly. Some of the hits dont look like they should have hit and sometime the killers can be toxic. If you can overlook these things and sometimes the meta perks then you'll enjoy this game.

Well somehow this game keeps me entertained. I love playing it with friends.

God, what can I even say? This is my most played game to date and, even after almost 1k hours, I still don't know how to feel about it. It can be some of the most trash-garbage 15 minutes of gameplay you will ever encounter with the most entitled of survivors and the most toxic of killers; where everyone is sweating so hard you can literally smell the must off of the basement-dweller trickster currently camping you, or how that one group of swf bunny fengs with flashlights teabagging you at the exit gates make you want to put your hands into a toaster and eat them.

But then it's also some of the most rewarding and/or fun(ny) gameplay I have ever experienced in a video game. When you actually get your first flashlight save, or accidentally walk into someone hiding in a bush and down them, or play with your friends and also meet some really cool people because of the game; even encountering 1 of the 3 people that main billy is something to behold. (i'll pray for u guys <3)

This game has toxicity, campers, tunnelers, entitlement, snoot-booping, bouncing billy's, jerryl's, killers and survivors from space, treasure chest bubba's, bleandettes, survivors farming your ass for absolutely no reason, 4 dh-ds-unbreakable's, twin mains (i think?), lots of questionable game mechanic choices, even more questionable developers, and SO. MANY. FENG. COSMETICS. OH MY GOD PEOPLE PLS. NO MORE. (justice for Jeff!!)

But yeah, whatever your opinion about this game is, there will probably never be another game like Dead by Daylight.

Should you get it? Idk it's your money. Although I will say that the 8 piece combo at KFC is the same price so...ðŸ˜³...maybe just first consider your options before buying.

Anyways, remember to have fun, touch gr(ass) once in a while (it's healthy for the soul), still love yourself after losing 17 killer games in a row, and sign my formal petition to add guns to DbD. Thank you for coming to my TED talk. 

tl;dr "[i] have u just considered...getting good?" ðŸ˜³ *toxic by britney spears starts playing* [/i]
Devs ignore key issues but put all their attention into political statements.

Do you hate yourself? Well this is the game for you!

DBD and I have a love/hate relationship. The game itself is super addicting and sometimes can be extremely fun and challenging. I love the different killers and survivors that are brought into the game along with all the different builds you can make because of so many perks and ad-ons. It is a lot of fun when you have a group of friends you can talk to during the game so you can be strategic and plan out your next moves. Bringing some of our favorite characters to the gaming community has been amazing.

However, I have had soooo many issues with matchmaking recently. It doesn't seem to matter if I play killer or survivor, I almost always end up playing against much higher rank tier opponent(s) and struggle because of it. Also, aside from Call of Duty, DBD's community of players are so toxic. I don't even think there's anything they can do about it but with the toxic players and poor matchmaking, I don't play this game as much as I use to, and I hate that because I really do love/hate the game. 

If you play the game correctly, be prepared to be called names by your opponents, either side that you're on.  Apparently, playing the game correctly is a big no no. You're supposed to let survivors go, not chase them. Also, you should 100% call the killers sweaty for hooking survivors. *gasp* Something to look forward to. 

10/10 do not recommend. 10/10 will continue playing. Over and over again.
super fun love playing with my friends!

Pretty fun rpg. For some reason, everyone keeps running from me though. I try and try to run up and wave, or make friends, but they all run away. Some will do this weird dance every once in a while, and that's fun. Other times they throw things at me though, and that hurts my feelings.
Buy the game, lots of fun

it was fun but survivors have cryed so much that it so hard x to win as killer this game is rellay bad now
Great game to play solo or to play with friends.
The toxicity of other players is a bummer but the horror aspect is definitely enjoyable

This game is good. It can be difficult at times I know but at the same time it is fun. I do not care about winning or losing, fun and experience is my way of gaming. With almost 1000 hours in dead by daylight I can say that things are looking very positive. This is probably one of the only multiplayer games where the devs care. You probably think that they don't...but no they do. Here I will explain my reasoning. Players wanted a dating sim. First it started off as a joke, but then we took it seriously. Eventually the devs thought about it and what did they do in response? Make a new game about it. Hell, I might even buy it. So why the thumbs up even though dead by daylight has had some major issues from the past few months? Well I will tell you why. The devs listen and their marketing team is amazing. That is it and that's what makes me stay to keep on playing. Also to add on to this. To make the game more balanced in my opinion is if they add the character Morbius. Not just one Morbius but two Morbius's. Yes two Morbius's. One for the survivor and one for the killer. Don't you want to see Morbius again in action? It's the worlds highest-grossing film! I know I have heard rumors of a vampire killer so lets bring out the Morbius. Morbius's killer power can be his morbin ability where he can morb all over the survivors. A Morbius license for dead by daylight please! #morbiusbydaylight. P.S. we need Frank West as a survivor please and thank you. So yeah that's all I have to really say. Cya.
It's a great game. Don't let some of the toxic players get to you. That's the only downside

Let me just say this game is an absolute mess. From the community, to the developers of this game. This game rewards whoever plays the most scummy and brainless strategies. As a killer survivors have such an advantage over you, its like you need to rely on the survivors getting a mistake. On top of that people playing survivor are so toxic (and killers too) that this game is guaranteed to make you have a bad day eventually. The good things you do in the game feel so pointless, which makes you pay attention to the negative more than the positive. And as a survivor, killers use the most brainless strategies to get kills, such as camping or tunneling (with Bubba especially). Which anyone can do, and its so dumb. However, I do see why some killers do that, sometimes they have no choice because they're losing so badly, or they're just doing it because they're toxic. And as I was saying with toxic survivors, these survivors will T-bag you at any given moment whether you get pallet stunned, or they're waiting for you as a killer to force them out of the exit gate T-bagging you the whole time. For the developers, The way they have made the game gets stale very quickly, every killer or survivor will run a certain OP perk that everyone uses and you just expect it. It does not make the game fun to go against people who are just using the same perks over and over again. And after 350 hours of this game i'm done with this crap, and if i ever return to this game it will be a long time coming, considering the state of the game.
goood game :) come b eat me
Intense survival co-op game! Really fun to play with a consistent group, but frustrating to play as the killer. I see myself playing this game for a long time to grind/improve which is fine by me.
